data.title: Police: Steuben County man charged with murder after attacking sister with frying pan
data.meta_description: Painted Post, N.Y. A man from Steuben County is charged with murder after he allegedly hit his sister with a cast-iron frying pan and killed her.Police said Joh
data.text:
Painted Post, N.Y. â€” A man from Steuben County is charged with murder after he allegedly hit his sister with a cast-iron frying pan and killed her.

Police said John Marvin II, 59, of Painted Post, struck Heather Moran, 60, during an altercation Tuesday in the town of Erwin while Moran was sitting a table with their 81-year-old father.

Investigators said their father got out of his wheelchair and tried to intervene but fell. He was not injured. Police said Moran had arrived at the home earlier to help Marvin care for their father.

Moran died from her injuries Wednesday after being flown to Guthrie Robert Packer Hospital in Sayre, Pa.

Police said Marvin called 911 and waited for authorities. He was taken into custody without incident.

Marvin is charged with second-degree murder and assault. He was taken to Steuben County Jail and is being held without bail. The incident remains under investigation.
